unnormalised: AIIMS Delhi reports a breakthrough in genetic disease research! Dr. Rajesh Kumar's team has identified a novel gene linked to a rare form of muscular dystrophy, currently termed MD-X. Early trials using CRISPR tech showed promising results in cell cultures.
normalised: A-I-I-M-S Delhi reports a breakthrough in genetic disease research! Doctor Rajesh Kumar's team has identified a novel gene linked to a rare form of muscular dystrophy, currently termed M-D-X. Early trials using C-R-I-S-P-R tech showed promising results in cell cultures.

unnormalised: The study, published in the Indian Journal of Medical Genetics (IJMG), involved analyzing the genomes of 15 families affected by MD-X. The genetic marker was located on chromosome 17 and designated as 'GeneX-IN'. Further research will focus on developing targeted therapies, possibly gene therapy, to correct the mutation. A nationwide screening program, costing ~Rs. 5 crore, is being proposed.
normalised: The study, published in the Indian Journal of Medical Genetics (I-J-M-G), involved analyzing the genomes of fifteen families affected by M-D-X. The genetic marker was located on chromosome seventeen and designated as 'GeneX-I-N'. Further research will focus on developing targeted therapies, possibly gene therapy, to correct the mutation. A nationwide screening program, costing approximately rupee five crore, is being proposed.

unnormalised: "This is a significant step, but it's early days," Dr. Kumar stated. "We estimate that about 1 in 10,000 Indians may carry this gene. We're hoping to start human trials by Q4 2024. Stay tuned, folks!" A helpine number (+91-11-26588500) has been set up for queries.
normalised: "This is a significant step, but it's early days," Doctor Kumar stated. "We estimate that about one in ten thousand Indians may carry this gene. We're hoping to start human trials by Q four two thousand and twenty four. Stay tuned, folks!" A helpline number (plus ninety one dash eleven dash two six five double eight five double zero) has been set up for queries.
